member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.DataflowProgress`1
member.summary: A progress implementation that sends progress reports to a dataflow block (via ). Optionally shuts down the dataflow block when the task completes.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.DataflowProgress`1._block
member.summary: The dataflow block to pass progress reports to.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.DataflowProgress`1.#ctor(System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.ITargetBlock{`0})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The dataflow block to pass progress reports to. May not be null.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.DataflowProgress`1.ObserveTaskForCompletion(System.Threading.Tasks.Task)
member.summary: Watches the task, and shuts down the dataflow block (via or ) when the task completes.
member.param: The task to watch. May not be null.

member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.FuncBlock`1
member.summary: A dataflow block which uses a function to generate its items.
member.typeparam: The type of items generated by the function.

remarks.para: If the function returns, then this block is completed.
If the function throws , then this block is completed.
If the function throws another exception, then this block is faulted.
If this block is cancelled (by cancelling the member of the ), then this block is cancelled and then the function is cancelled by having its method argument throw .
If this block is completed (by calling ), then this block is completed and then the function is cancelled by having its method argument throw .
If this block is faulted (by calling ), then this block is faulted and then the function is cancelled by having its method argument throw .

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.FuncBlock`1._block
member.summary: The internal buffer block, holding items that have been generated by the function but not yet passed on.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.FuncBlock`1._functionCancellationTokenSource
member.summary: The CTS used to signal the function to stop.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.FuncBlock`1._options
member.summary: The options used to construct this block.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.FuncBlock`1._function
member.summary: The producer function.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.FuncBlock`1.#ctor(System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.DataflowBlockOptions)
member.summary: Initializes the block and CTS.
member.param: The options with which to configure this block.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.FuncBlock`1.#ctor(System.Func{System.Func{`0,System.Threading.Tasks.Task},System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Threading.Tasks.Task},System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.DataflowBlockOptions)
member.summary: Initializes the block with the specified options and a function which takes a cancellation token.
member.param: The asynchronous function which generates items. If this function returns or throws an , then this block will complete. If this function throws another exception, then this block will fault. The first argument to this function ("send") is an asynchronous method to send an item to this block; the "send" method will throw if the block has completed and the function should exit. The second argument to this function is a cancellation token that will be cancelled if the block has completed and the function should exit.
The options with which to configure this block. If the cancellation token is cancelled, then this block will cancel and then the next call to the function's "send" method will throw .

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.FuncBlock`1.#ctor(System.Func{System.Func{`0,System.Threading.Tasks.Task},System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Initializes the block with a function which takes a cancellation token.
member.param: The asynchronous function which generates items. If this function returns or throws an , then this block will complete. If this function throws another exception, then this block will fault. The first argument to this function ("send") is an asynchronous method to send an item to this block; the "send" method will throw if the block has completed and the function should exit. The second argument to this function is a cancellation token that will be cancelled if the block has completed and the function should exit.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.FuncBlock`1.#ctor(System.Func{System.Func{`0,System.Threading.Tasks.Task},System.Threading.Tasks.Task},System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.DataflowBlockOptions)
member.summary: Initializes the block with the specified options and a function which does not take a cancellation token.
member.param: The asynchronous function which generates items. If this function returns or throws an , then this block will complete. If this function throws another exception, then this block will fault. The argument to this function ("send") is an asynchronous method to send an item to this block; the "send" method will throw if the block has completed and the function should exit.
The options with which to configure this block. If the cancellation token is cancelled, then this block will cancel and then the next call to the function's "send" method will throw .

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.FuncBlock`1.#ctor(System.Func{System.Func{`0,System.Threading.Tasks.Task},System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Initializes the block with a function which does not take a cancellation token.
member.param: The asynchronous function which generates items. If this function returns or throws an , then this block will complete. If this function throws another exception, then this block will fault. The argument to this function ("send") is an asynchronous method to send an item to this block; the "send" method will throw if the block has completed and the function should exit.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.FuncBlock`1.Dispose
member.summary: Releases resources used by this instance. Use of this instance after disposal is undefined.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.FuncBlock`1.FunctionSendAsync(`0)
member.summary: The method called by the function to send an item to the block.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.FuncBlock`1.PropagateResult(System.Threading.Tasks.Task)
member.summary: The continuation applied to the function to interpret an exception as a fault and a success/cancel as a completion.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.FuncBlock`1.TryReceive(System.Predicate{`0},`0@)
member.summary: Attempts to synchronously receive an available output item from the block.
member.param: The predicate value must successfully pass in order for it to be received. may be null, in which case all items will pass.
The item received from the source.
member.returns: true if an item could be received; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.FuncBlock`1.TryReceiveAll(System.Collections.Generic.IList{`0}@)
member.summary: Attempts to synchronously receive all available items from the block.
member.param: The items received from the source.
member.returns: true if one or more items could be received; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.FuncBlock`1.LinkTo(System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.ITargetBlock{`0},System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.DataflowLinkOptions)
member.summary: Links the block to the specified .
member.param: The to which to connect this source.
A instance that configures the link.
member.returns: An IDisposable that, upon calling Dispose, will unlink the source from the target.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.FuncBlock`1.Complete
member.summary: Signals to the block that it should not produce any more messages. This block will complete and then the next call to the function's "send" method will throw .

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.FuncBlock`1.System#Threading#Tasks#Dataflow#IDataflowBlock#Fault(System.Exception)
member.summary: Signals to the block that it should enter a fault state and not produce any more messages. This block will fault and then the next call to the function's "send" method will throw .

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.FuncBlock`1.Name
member.summary: Gets the name for this block.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.FuncBlock`1.Completion
member.summary: Gets a that represents the asynchronous operation and completion of the dataflow block.
